head.title: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Newark: Man Arraigned In Hostage Standoff

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Newark: Man Arraigned In Hostage Standoff

body.head.byline: By John Holl (NYT); Compiled by Anthony Ramirez

abstract.p: Almutah Saunders is arraigned in Newark, NJ, on charges of attempted murder and kidnapping for taking former girlfriend Erika Turner and their baby daughter captive and leading police on chase that ended in nearly eight-hour standoff (S)

block.p: A man accused of taking a woman and their baby daughter hostage, then leading the police on a chase that ended in a seven-and-a-half-hour standoff, was arraigned in Essex County Court yesterday on charges of attempted murder, kidnapping and other crimes, the authorities said. Prosecutors said the man, Almutah Saunders, 26, of East Orange, burst into the apartment of his ex-girlfriend, Erika Turner, on Monday morning and shot Ms. Turner's father in the leg. The father, Eric Turner, remains in fair condition at University Hospital in Newark. Mr. Saunders is being held in the Essex County jail in $2 million bail.
